summary:
Seasoned executive with over 35 years’ experience running and consulting to global businesses. Steven is viewed as a passionate leader who rolls up his sleeves and “just gets things done”, able to manage a great deal of complexity simultaneously. He has lived and worked in San Francisco, Boston, London, Warsaw, Moscow, Tokyo, New Delhi, Brussels and Amsterdam. 

In a world where people increasingly jump from company to company, Steven has spent his entire career helping to build Bain & Company, the international management consultancy. From 2000 to 2019, Steven served as Head of Global Operations (Chief Operations and Sustainability Officer) and, during this time, was a member of the Global Operating Committee, the firm's leadership team. He reported to four consecutive Worldwide Managing Partners, managed a team of over 1000 staff with an annual budget of $150M+ USD. 

During the time that Steven served as a member of the firm’s leadership team, Bain grew 4x, averaging 10% growth per year, staff grew by 5x, and offices expanded globally from 24 to 65 locations. Bain is known for its people-centric culture and has been widely acknowledged as a great place to work: 
•	Ranked #1 in the world four times by Glassdoor, and has appeared in the top four companies on the Best Places to Work list for the past 12 years. Also ranked in 2017’s as the #1 best employer in Netherlands & Germany
•	Ranked in the 100 best companies to work for by Fortune magazine. Ranked on Fortune’s 2019 Best Workplaces for Diversity list 
•	Recognized as a Top 10 company in Working Mother’s magazine’s “100 Best Companies” list for 12 years 
•	Recognized by Mogul in 2019 as a Top 10 Data and Consulting company for millennial women, Best Place to Work for Gen Z, and Best Place to Work in the US
•	Recognized by the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's (HRC) annual Corporate Equality Index (CEI) as one of the "Best Places to Work for GLBTQ Equality," earning a perfect score of 100% for the last 14 years
•	Achieved Gold on the EcoVadis CSR rating in 2019. This is the highest recognition given by the leading environmental, social and ethical performance scorecard. In achieving Gold, Bain ranks among the top 5% of companies globally for corporate responsibility

Steven has been quoted in the New York Times and other publications, and has guest lectured in many business schools, including INSEAD, Stanford GBS, Harvard, Wharton, Berkeley, and Babson

awards.title: OUTstanding in Business Rankings
awards.description: Steven was named by the UK Financial Times as one of the top 25 most influential gay business executives in their first-ever OUTstanding in Business rankings.

awards.title: Nicholas Bright / Peter Dix Award
awards.description: This is Bain’s highest internal award and is given to an individual each year who exemplifies a culture of mentoring, training and developing staff. This annual award is named after two Bain managers who were killed on Pan Am flight 103, which exploded over Lockerbie, Scotland in 1988.

profile_positions.description: Steven is responsible for Bain's Global Real Estate portfolio of 65+ offices and team that finds locations, negotiates leases, then designs and builds new spaces.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Partner

profile_positions.description:
From 2000 to 2019, he has served on Bain's Global Operating Committee and led its Global Operations group. 

In the role of Vice President of Global Operations (Chief Operations and Sustainability Officer), Steven was responsible for many fuctions including: Bain's Technology Services Group (IT operations & systems), the Advanced Analytics Group, the Advanced Digital Product Support Team, the Design & Development Labs, the Information Services and research function, Consulting Operations, the Bain Capability and Shared Services Centers in Gurgaon, India, the EMEA Shared Services Center in Warsaw, Poland, and the Travel department. For some period, he also ran Global Training, Knowledge Management, the Global Experience Center, and Bain.com. 

Steven also supported the expansion of Bain’s global footprint and the opening of new offices, was the executive sponsor of BGLAD (the Bain LGBTQ+ group) and served as the firm’s Sustainability Officer, responsible for its annual carbon neutral certification.
profile_positions.title: Partner and Head of Global Operations

profile_positions.description: Served as Bain’s first Head of Training where he built the internal training team and launched Bain’s first global training programs for consultants, managers, and partners. He conceived and implemented Bain’s award-winning virtual university and developed the GXC (Global Experience Center), Bain’s online knowledge management platform. Steven developed the firm’s overall training strategy and philosophy, the core of which is still in use today. He also created a group focused on client communications to upskill our staff and their ability to make persuasive presentations. Since this time, Bain’s training has been recognized as the best in its industry and has been named Vault’s #1 in formal and informal training in consulting 16 times
profile_positions.title: Vice President, Global Training

profile_positions.description: Steven spent his first decade with Bain as a member of the consulting staff advising clients on a broad range of strategic and operational issues. Specialties included privatization and telecommunications. Lived during this period in San Francisco, Tokyo, Warsaw and Moscow. In Poland immediately after the fall of communism, led privatization of companies in two sectors. This was followed in Russia where he led a team of 54 consultants charged with the privatization of over 2500 firms as part of the National Voucher Auction privatization program.
